author: Jen Mills For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Baby taken into care after father was heard 'praising formula milk' | Metro News
text:
Jen Mills for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 8:38 pm He was heard praising formula milk (Picture: Getty) 
Social services took a week-old baby into care after his dad praised ‘the benefits of formula milk’, a judge has heard. 
The father was accused of expressing ‘unorthodox views’ about bottle sterilisation and feeding. 
Medical staff who heard the comment raised concerns, which sparked the series of events which led to the infant wrongly being taken into care. 
He has been allowed to come back to his parents and is now ‘thriving’. 
In a damning decision by the High Court in London, Kirklees Council has been ordered to pay the mother, the father, and the little boy a total of £11,250 in damages. 
Mr Justice Cobb said there was ‘no doubt in my mind’ that the council had violated the family’s human rights – and even ‘misled’ a family judge. Mr Justice Cobb gave the decision at the family division of the High Court (Picture: Photoshoot) 
Kirklees Council had persuaded a judge to allow the baby to be taken into emergency care without his parents even knowing the hearing was going on. 
The mother, in her 20s, suffered from minor mental health problems and learning difficulties and the father had in the past been aggressive to others. 
But staff at the special care baby unit where he was cared for in the days after his delivery had expressed ‘no child protection concerns’. 
Maternity ward medics had told the council they were anxious about the couple’s long-term ability to care for their baby. 
Just before the baby was due to be discharged from hospital into his parents’ care, the council rushed to court and obtained an emergency care order. 
The judge was told that the parents were ‘on notice’ of the hearing and had ‘agreed’ to their baby being taken away from them.
